description: Returns the routing configuration for a Multi-Region Access Point, indicating which Regions are active or passive. To obtain routing control changes and failover requests, use the Amazon S3 failover control infrastructure endpoints in these five Amazon Web Services Regions:

parameters.name: AccountId
parameters.description: The Amazon Web Services account ID for the owner of the Multi-Region Access Point.

nested_items.name: Routes
nested_items.description: The different routes that make up the route configuration. Active routes return a value of 100, and passive routes return a value of 0.

nested_items.name: Bucket
nested_items.description: The name of the Amazon S3 bucket for which you'll submit a routing configuration change. Either the Bucket or the Region value must be provided. If both are provided, the bucket must be in the specified Region.

nested_items.name: Region
nested_items.description: The Amazon Web Services Region to which you'll be submitting a routing configuration change. Either the Bucket or the Region value must be provided. If both are provided, the bucket must be in the specified Region.

nested_items.name: TrafficDialPercentage
nested_items.description: The traffic state for the specified bucket or Amazon Web Services Region.
